intro: Champereia gnetocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gnetaceae, which is closely related to conifers, and is one of the few living members of the order Gnetales. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its unique botanical features include a distinctive seed structure with a hard, woody outer coat. Champereia gnetocarpa is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient plant in regions with limited rainfall.
